data.name: RES_ExceptionCantCreateStatePersistenceProvider
data.value: The state persistence provider {0} cannot be created. Check the /configuration/uipConfiguration/objectTypes/statePersistenceProvider node in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or web.config). This node must be like <statePersistenceProvider name="SqlServerPersistState" type="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.UIProcess.SqlPersistState, Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.UIProcess" connectionString="Connection"></statePersistenceProvider>

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantCreateState
data.value: The state object {0} cannot be created. Check the /configuration/uipConfiguration/objectTypes/state node in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or web.config). This node must be like <state name="State" type="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.UIProcess.State, Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.UIProcess" ></state>

data.name: RES_ExceptionUIPConfigNotFound
data.value: The user process configuration section is not configured. Check the /configuration/uipConfiguration node in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or web.config).

data.name: RES_ExceptionIViewManagerNotFound
data.value: The view manager related to the navigation graph {0} is not configured. Check the /configuration/uipConfiguration/objectTypes/iViewManager node in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or web.config).

data.name: RES_ExceptionControllerNotFound
data.value: The controller related to the navigation graph {0} is not configured. Check the /configuration/uipConfiguration/objectTypes/controller node in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or web.config).

data.name: RES_ExceptionLoadUIPConfig
data.value: Error loading UIP config parameters.

data.name: RES_ExceptionSQLStatePersistenceProviderInit
data.value: Error initializing the SQL state persistence provider. Parameter {0}

data.name: RES_ExceptionSQLStatePersistenceProviderDehydrate
data.value: Can not save the specified state object

data.name: RES_ExceptionSQLStatePersistenceProviderRehydrate
data.value: Can not load the specified state object

data.name: RES_ExceptionStartViewConfigNotFound
data.value: The start view is not configured. Check the /configuration/uipConfiguration/navigationGraph node in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or web.config)

data.name: RES_ExceptionViewConfigNotFound
data.value: The view {0} is not configured. Check the /configuration/uipConfiguration/views node in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or web.config).

data.name: RES_ExceptionStatePersistenceProviderConfigNotFound
data.value: The state persistence provider for the navigation graph {0} is not configured. Check the /configuration/uipConfiguration/objectTypes/statePersistenceProvider node in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or web.config).

data.name: RES_ExceptionCouldNotGetNextViewType
data.value: Given arguments NavigationGraph={0}, CurrentView={1}, and NavigateValue={2}, could not find next View name. Check the config file to be sure that given the current parameters a next View can be derived correctly; be sure there is a navigateTo node corresponding to this combination of parameters.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidXmlAttributeValue
data.value: Could not load the xml configuration because the attribute "{0}" has a invalid value. Xml node "{1}"

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidCacheExpirationInterval
data.value: The configured cache expiration interval is invalid

data.name: RES_ExceptionSecureSqlProviderRegistryPermissions
data.value: You do not have the necessary registry read permissions to use this provider

data.name: RES_ExceptionSecureSqlProviderSymmetricKey
data.value: Error trying to get the provider symmetric key from the registry

data.name: RES_ExceptionSecureSqlProviderCantEncrypt
data.value: Can not encrypt the serialized state

data.name: RES_ExceptionSecureSqlProviderCantDecrypt
data.value: Can not decrypt the serialized state

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantInitializeController
data.value: The view {0} controller cannot be initialized.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantSetViewProperty
data.value: Error trying to set a custom property to the current view manager.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantActivateView
data.value: Can not activate the view {0}.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantGetSessionMoniker
data.value: Can not get the session moniker for the task {0}.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantCreateIViewManager
data.value: The IViewManager {0} cannot be created. Check the /configuration/uipConfiguration/objectTypes/iViewManager node in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or Web.config). This node must be like <iViewManager name="WebFormViewManager" type="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.UIProcess.WebFormViewManager, Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.UIProcess"></iViewManager>

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantLoadAssembly
data.value: The assembly {0} could not be loaded. Please check that the assembly type is fully qualified and is of format that follows. Also be sure that the version and public key token are correct. The correct format is: type="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.UIProcess.Samples.AddressWizard.WizardController, Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.UIProcess.Samples.AddressWizard, Version=1.0.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=d69d63db1380c14d"

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidCastInCopyToArray
data.value: An invalid cast was produced when trying to copy the state to given System.Array

data.name: RES_ExceptionIncorrectNumberOfItemsInTaskMonikerString
data.value: The specified task moniker string is invalid. It has an incorrect number of items. The task moniker string must have three items viz, navigationGraph, currentview and taskId.

data.name: RES_ExceptionNullArrayInCopyToArray
data.value: Could not copy State hashtable members to given System.Array because the specified array is null

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidArrayDimensionsInCopyToArray
data.value: Could not copy State hashtable members to given System.Array because the given array is not one-dimensional

data.name: RES_ExceptionOutOfBoundsIndexInCopyToArray
data.value: Could not copy State hashtable members to given System.Array because the index is less than zero or exceeds the bounds of the array

data.name: RES_ExceptionTaskNotFound
data.value: Task not found. Id: {0}

data.name: RES_ExceptionBadTypeArgumentInFactory
data.value: The type names must be specified using the full type name and the 5 parts of the assembly name: typeName, assemblyName, version, publicToken, culture.

data.name: RES_ExceptionDocumentNotValidated
data.value: The section for the UIP configuration does not conforms to the XMLSchema provided, please check the document to fix the document. The validation error message is: {0}.

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidAbsoluteInterval
data.value: The absolute cache interval is invalid. It must not contain a day part.

data.name: RES_ExceptionNavigationGraphNotFound
data.value: The navigation graph {0} is not configured. Check the /configuration/navigationGraph nodes in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or Web.config).

data.name: RES_ExceptionStateConfigNotFound
data.value: The state object for the navigation graph {0} is not configured. Check the /configuration/uipConfiguration/objectTypes/state node in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or web.config).

data.name: RES_ExceptionViewSettingAlreadyConfigured
data.value: The view has been configured several times. View name {0}

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantCreateInstanceUsingActivate
data.value: An instance of the type {0} could not be loaded. Please check that the assembly type is fully qualified and is of the format: type="Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.UIProcess.Samples.AddressWizard.WizardController, Microsoft.ApplicationBlocks.UIProcess.Samples.AddressWizard, Version=1.0.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=d69d63db1380c14d" ANOTHER possibility is that the object creation failed during construction; be sure you have supplied the correct constructor arguments, and that the type to be created has implemented the constructor overloads/overrides required

data.name: RES_ExceptionStateNotInitialized
data.value: The state has not been initialized with a persistence provider. You must call the "Accept" method

data.name: RES_ExceptionDuplicateNavigateGraphSharedTransition
data.value: The shared transition {0} has already been defined for the {1} navigation graph

data.name: RES_ExceptionDuplicateGlobalSharedTransition
data.value: The global shared transition {0} has already been defined

data.name: RES_ExceptionLayoutManagerNotFound
data.value: The layout manager {0} could not be found.

data.name: RES_ExceptionConflictingFloatingWindowsAttribute
data.value: A view can not have both attribute {0} and {1} set to true.

data.name: RES_ExceptionCantGetTypeFromAssembly
data.value: The type {0} could not be found in assembly {1}.

data.name: RES_ExceptionHostedControlsNotFound
data.value: The hosted controls element {0} is not configured. Check the /configuration/hostedControls nodes in the application config file (AssemblyFileName.config or Web.config).

data.name: RES_ExceptionWizardViewManagerIsRequired
data.value: The WizardNavigator has to use a viewmanager that is either of type of WizardViewManager or inheritance from WizardViewManager

data.name: RES_ExceptionFirstExceptionMessage
data.value: The original exception is: {0} {1}

data.name: RES_ExceptionInvalidWizardName
data.value: Wizard name is invalid.
